Home.ScanrIs.main.title: scanR, what is it?
Home.ScanrIs.main.text: As a search engine, scanR makes it possible to search and explore the French research and innovation landscape, through research entities, authors, funding and productions (theses, publications, patents).
Home.ScanrIs.main.ministry: scanR is a service offered by the Ministry of Higher Education, Research and Innovation
Home.ScanrIs.section.first.title: Enriched and linked data
Home.ScanrIs.section.first.text: scanR allows you to search for different types of objects, ranging from research structures to funding projects, authors and their productions (publications, theses and patents). By linking all these objects, contextualized research results can be obtained and characterized in the complex landscape of the world of research and innovation
Home.ScanrIs.section.second.title: Thematic focuses to deepen a subject
Home.ScanrIs.section.second.text: Specific thematics are deepened in the focuses. A contextualisation and specific data-visualisations are carried out. For each focus, the underlying data is available, either directly in scanR, or in an open data set
Home.ScanrIs.section.third.title: Tools to make the most of the proposed data
Home.ScanrIs.section.third.text: scanR offers possibilities for discovery, visualization and massive exploitation. For example, for each type of object, scanR highlights similar objects, linked to the same research themes. In addition, visualization tools are available both on each page of search results and on the characterization sheets of entities, projects, authors and publications
Home.ScanrIs.section.forth.title: Open and reusable data
Home.ScanrIs.section.forth.text: The data used by scanR is freely accessible under license for reuse via APIs and datasets are on the Opendata platform of the Ministry of Higher Education, Research and Innovation
Home.ScanrIs.section.fifth.title: Listening to its users
Home.ScanrIs.section.fifth.text: Have you identified an error or omission on a particular entity, author, production or financing record?
